text: when I tell people that I've made a
sexual health circus often there's a
little click where they go so the show
covers about seven or eight different
topics and in each topic we've got key
messages I think some of the benefits of
teaching sexual have through Circus as
well as in classroom is to help young
people navigate this rocky road often of
adolescence and sexual health it really
shows equality diversity very lgbtq+
healthy relationships in any context
doesn't have to be within the circus
would include things like being
respectful being trusting being
communicative so that's why we are
talking about pornography because it's
happening we are talking about sending
receiving new pictures because it is
just massively happening and and we're
talking about pleasure because we're
trying to be positive around sexual
health not just the negative sides of
contraception and sti's my own sex ed it
was my really awkward male physics
teacher in an all-girls school putting a
condom on a banana as the mandatory new
legislation is coming in having a
different way of teaching this
compulsory curriculum can only be a good
thing so we have a really tender section
of the show which doesn't have any
talking and it just shows this really
tender care and respect with each other
where we do different acrobatics on each
other and I feel like it's also a
message of hey guys it's okay
- you know be vulnerable to be sensitive
to be loving to be caring if that's with
any gender once they've got all that
information there then much more
equipped to go out into the world and
have positive healthy nice fun
relationships if they want and there are
more free from harm and to make
hopefully good choices for themselves
and their future
